cyclone.name: LAURA
cyclone.current_location: about 50 miles north of the western tip of Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: moving WNW today, then turning NW and NNW, tracking toward the upper Texas and southwest Louisiana Gulf Coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the Texas–Louisiana border, close to Port Arthur TX / Cameron LA

weather_observation.watch_coast: Port Bolivar TX to west of Morgan City LA
weather_observation.warning_coast: None yet for this segment of coast (Surge Watch San Luis Pass TX to Ocean Springs MS)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Upper Texas and southwest Louisiana coastline (including Sabine Lake and Galveston Bay)
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds likely late Wednesday, hurricane-force gusts possible during landfall early Thursday
weather_observation.storm_surge: Potential inundation 7–11 ft above ground level in Sabine Lake and adjacent coastal areas if peak surge coincides with high tide
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–8 inches with isolated totals up to 12 inches possible, producing flash and urban flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes possible in outer rain bands Wednesday night and Thursday
